awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Combinatorics, Complexity and        Convexity
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports the research of Professor V. Klee                      to work in combinatorics, optimization, and computational                       geometry.  He intends to work on higher dimensional                             computational geometry, the d-step conjecture in linear                         programming and qualitative analysis of linear systems.                              The research falls cross lines between the areas of                        combinatorics, optimization theory and computational                            geometry.  Combinatorics attempts to find efficient methods                     to study how discrete collections of objects can be organized.                  And, so it is extremely important to modern communications.                     Optimization theory, first came to prominence in World                          War II, when the theory of linear programming was used so                       successfully.  Computational geometry is fundamental to                         areas as diverse as CAD/CAM modelling and Robotics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
